patterns.comment: This scope identifies partially typed commands such as `\tab`. We use this to trigger “Command Completion” only when it makes sense.
patterns.name: meta.space-after-command.latex

patterns.begin:
(?x)
				(													# Capture 1
					(\\)											# Marker
					(
						(?:sub){0,2}section							# Functions
					  | (?:sub)?paragraph
					  | chapter|part|addpart
					  | addchap|addsec|minisec
					)
					(?:\*)?											# Optional Unnumbered
				)
				(?:
					(\[)([^\[]*?)(\])								# Optional Title
				)??
				(\{)												# Opening Bracket
patterns.comment: this works OK with all kinds of crazy stuff as long as section is one line
patterns.name: meta.function.section.$3.latex

patterns.comment: it should treat difference between luacode* and luacode better
patterns.name: meta.embedded.block.lua

patterns.comment: These two patterns match the \begin{document} and \end{document} commands, so that the environment matching pattern following them will ignore those commands.
patterns.name: meta.function.begin-document.latex

patterns.begin:
(?x)
					(?:\s*)										# Optional whitespace
					((\\)begin)									# Marker - Function
					(\{)										# Open Bracket
						(
							(?:
								align|equation|eqnarray			# Argument
							  | multline|aligned|alignat
							  | split|gather|gathered
							)
							(?:\*)?								# Optional Unnumbered
						)
					(\})										# Close Bracket
					(\s*\n)?				# Match to end of line absent of content
patterns.end:
(?x)
					(?:\s*)										# Optional whitespace
					((\\)end)									# Marker - Function
					(\{)										# Open Bracket
						(\4)				# Previous capture from begin
					(\})										# Close Bracket
					(?:\s*\n)?				# Match to end of line absent of content
patterns.name: meta.function.environment.math.latex

patterns.begin:
(?x)
					(?:\s*)										# Optional whitespace
					((\\)begin)									# Marker - Function
					(\{)										# Open Bracket
						(array|tabular[xy*]?)
					(\})										# Close Bracket
					(\s*\n)?				# Match to end of line absent of content
patterns.end:
(?x)
					(?:\s*)										# Optional whitespace
					((\\)end)									# Marker - Function
					(\{)										# Open Bracket
						(\4)				# Previous capture from begin
					(\})										# Close Bracket
					(?:\s*\n)?				# Match to end of line absent of content
patterns.name: meta.function.environment.tabular.latex

patterns.comment:
We put the keyword in a capture and name this capture, so that disabling spell checking for “keyword” won't be inherited by the argument to \textit{...}.

Put specific matches for particular LaTeX keyword.functions before the last two more general functions
patterns.name: meta.function.textit.latex

patterns.begin:
(?x)
					(
						(\\)										# Marker
						(?:auto|foot|full|no|short|[tT]ext)?		# Function Name
						[cC]ite
						(?:al)?(?:t|p|author|year(?:par)?|title)?[ANP]*
						\*?											# Optional Unabreviated
					)
					(?:(\[)[^\]]*(\]))?								# Optional
					(?:(\[)[^\]]*(\]))?								#   Arguments
					(\{)											# Opening Bracket
patterns.name: meta.citation.latex
